have you guys considered for NEAT v2 a g=
ene to be not just a link, but a group of links ? And even more, a gene to =
be a well defined large network ? I have found this video called "inner lif=
e of a cell", amazing video btw:
http://www.studiodaily.com/main/searchlist=
/6850.html
for example, check the motor protein walking on the video and ca=
rrying a sphere of lipids, that gene has only one function of "moving stuff=
". Could next version of NEAT evolve something like that and separate it as=
 a net and name it as some sort of "complex gene", for later reuse to build=
 more complex structures? For example, it would scan through whole populati=
on, and recognize inside each network, a small subnetwork that is repeating=
 along many species, then it would disconnect this network, and name it as =
a gene. Do you think it could work ?

Thanks for your comments.
